TextBlock.TextLine: 2 maij 1681
Att hondon Ebramlivan
m. ny last te you was on the d curt so which inferre you brcaus
sende non from uijouly this eaccuse I haveunsiddered this itt
will nst beso well, te beso pleue with in potter as I desired
by my last in giveing hum yd fullorder for all the goods
befers veesece some moe of hil doyiny. thought good to
portt you en minde agai of itt te considoer itt weel
& if oft was not aswell that he shoul have orders for 2or 2
leuter mey of eack sort fir seure my last anstold that oom
whill of heeds andets ster brying Rorderingeerij
& diesser well, te hiever &leave all tegen tehat is on yesid
ne Scouldens hweemight have good goods, & that nootherr
ourtdont Brutend fir wissels theus week &laeneat shalllle
meeitting e sulft grust
9 meij 1681
th C
London Will Scawen
Sr. my last to you was on the 8 curitt. sence recd. yd of 25: past, as to
our goods the bale N.11 is well past, & now with wee as alsoothe 5 others
bales, butt 250 dyed salempores in 4 packes off cottons are seased up on
att Brugges, affer they had been sealed & reshipt, so that they have aven
out the ƒ50 peeces & delivered up the cottons which I exspect dagly in
coots is now here, which is now simall preiudice, whoewer hentendes
to be att bruges next dues day & sought they have entred part of the
callicoes, yett I doubt itt will prove a loosing bussyness which
had never happined in case you had followed my advise to ship butt
one orrt bales in each vessel so now that way beengfound ontwee
must pactise an other orelee leave that trade, as soone as coots
be att bruges & that I know how the matter be advisted shall advise
you, for I ordered him to do his endeavwe to cleare itt by feare
meanes, for itt will be better an ill or baddaggrement then agood
suite in lace, for which in this regard wee have butt small reason: I hope
the packett & N.2 in yd possession & that you shall be able to dispose
of boath parcells p. first which is much recommended toydeare
9 maij 1681
London Henry Maynard
Sr my last to you was on the 7 curitt with £110: a ½ uso dedai porten
for my acctt. & £29:3 att 35:7 for yd acctt. on m. manbert which & formard
I hope ure come to yd handes now: am with yd of 25 past with
invoyce & patt. for a pack low prijsed spanish cloathes, the collours
are good butt I doubt some awill be turead bare as I can discover
by these patt. you will do well to take yd owne soime to provide
the rest, that so wee might have good goods I have given yd acctt
creditt for my ½ part in the invoyce as well for spanish aspacs white
cloathes, as also the bayes att Hull & returne you thanckes fory
care & diligeney to finnish our ware house with the needfull I do
promise from my part that Ill do all I can to in corridge you
in the continuany of the same, as well in selling to good prijses
as makeing due remises as to the estate of the widow bouwens
the exceutours have not yett made aresolution what to do, I have
examineed all the goods resting which I found butt few & all in
a very ill condition: come do persuade ince to remone mj whire
housed in kersi & some are of a coxtrary advise & that yd be
I would faire know the more because now in demont is dead
thought itt zeems thathis relations will continew that toade
our bale MN.11 is here butt the other 4 packes are in the
Burgatory, the cottons beeng declared are delivered up & sent forward by
willeerde butt the callicoes are taken out att Brugges & thought 3000 elles
declared yett I doubt wee will be loosers coots is there now & seems much
to be concerned, though he promises to make itt aff as well as possible
I write this lett this day because I am Just going for Brussels att my
returne you shall have remises, as also Pargers advise from
Leyden Adam Sicolaet
In Antwerpen 12 maij 1681
mons. in antwoort aende ul van 29 aprill & 6 deser sal de af gesonden ½ coleure en stl
breet sweert verwaghten, ende daer mede best doen volgens ordre, als mede met de dicho
swerte die ul noch staet te senden, wegens het gelt dat ul versoeckt sal tegens
de naeste weke sien te remitteeren, t geene mogelijk is de luyden van bergen
en hebbe noch geen gelt gesonden, en wij hebbe van alle canten seer groote
claghten van sleghte negotie, met alle welke moeten pasientie nemen
terwijlen
In Antwerpen 12 maij 81
Amsterdam De Hulter & Van Homright
Messr. De Bewuste 33 vaten boter sijn mij de voorlede weke wel geworden
en al hoewel groote deb voor hebbe gedaen om de selve te verkoopen& soo hebbe eghter
niet gekonnen, niet wonder midts de laest mertdagh onse verse in lanse voor
ƒ11:Pc0. onverkoght is blijven staen, soo dat maer weijnigh apparientie
sien de dese int cort quijt te worden daer toe nochtans behoorlijk dat voor gedaen
wort: de wollen sijn hier aen gekomen en worden noch heden gelost: hoe deselve sullen
uyt vallen leert den tijt de langhe besproke bosschagische tapijten, sijn door
indispositie vanden maker soo lanck getardeert, eghter dese weke is mij belooft
die sullen konnen versonden worden waer in ul wijders kan dienst doen gelieft
Antwerpen 12 maij 1681
liberlijk te commandeeren
Rotterdam Joan vandermeulen
monsr. sedert den ul van 25 pass. sijnde 4 bekende packen mij op 30 ditto geworden
soo dat voor nu de Rek van onkoste hadde verwaght om volgens te reguleren om meerder
dien wegh doen passeren verlancke oock dat met John brouwe een eijnde gemaekt
wort om soo die pertije mede te sluyten waer mede blijve
In Antwerpen 13 maij 1681
Meggelen pat. patricius p. Georgio -
pa noijt deere gehadt, aen ul te scrijven, foute van occasie, desen alleen tot advies als dat
aen mij sijn gesonden 2 differente wisselbrieven ten last van sijne Eerw: vir ƒ 536: de
dato 19 aprill uyt brussel getroken door den Eerw: pater Columbanus a f spritu en ƒ464:
door pater as petro vanden selve dato seyde te betalen aen de ordre van guilliaume
kerque, die de selve voorder & soo mij sijn veindosceert ende vermidts weijnigh
gelegentheyt is op onse beurse om deselve te vernegotieren, soo neme devrijigheyt
ul deswesens te scrijven ofte pr avonture sijn Eerw. selfs occasie hadde om die
weirde mij alhier te laten ontfangen d'welke in antwoort hier van geirne vernem
om mij volgens te reguleren, de brieven sijn op sicht pr cassa pro governo
waer in sijn Eerw. insgelijkx kan dienen hebt liberlijk te commanderen
Antwarpe 13 maij 1681
Lille Richd. woushell
Sr. I have recd. in due time severall yd viz of 20 past 7 & 11 curitt the contents
do serve for my gouverno & have noted every perticular accordingly, as well of the
goods arrived as a comning, besides yd draught which will duely discharged, if
possible shall remitt you some mony, more att the end of the present whilst
I hope that the sale of so many goods will be no simall comfort to
the cash & assist you in yd greatest streights, you complaine of the spanise
cloathes from AM. touely I have great reason here to butt itt zeems they
can not helpitt, as itt goeths now, so that I have butt very few on handes &
in order no more then I finde do sell, the like I do in northrens goods, though
that sort prover better im Hill doth better then A.V. his correspondent
which now will be m. Thomas potter, which hath orderto provide some
goods for mee though not so much as I did least yeare, because I finde
mony so scareee that wee can not maintaine trade, findinge complaints
from all hand the wid dow bouwens here is dead, as also our y reatinay
gillis demont so that these 2 great whare houses will decrease & come
